alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:39AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Walker and Fayette Counties through 915 AM CST... At 839 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winfield to near Fayette to near Kennedy. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Carbon Hill, Berry, Glen Allen, Kansas, Nauvoo, Belk, Gu- Win, Eldridge, Bankston, Bluff, Stone Wall, Wayside, Richard Arthur Field, West Corona, Fayette County Public Lake, Cedrum Area, Holly Grove and Lupton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
